uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.servlet

Class WebappServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.servlet.WebappServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContainerAuthServlet, EmailChangeRequestServlet, LoginServlet, PasswordChangeRequestServlet, RegisterServlet, RemoteAuthServlet, ServeDataServlet, SessionServlet, TransitionServlet

    public abstract class WebappServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    webappServlet Base class for servlets in the web application, it hold generally useful methods for use by all servlets
    Author:
    spb
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        The attribute name for the message type. This is looked up in the message bundle to get the text

      • MESSAGE_EXTRA_ATTR

        public static final java.lang.String MESSAGE_EXTRA_ATTR
        The attribute name for the secondary message (optional) This can be passed as an attribute to add secondary text to a message default extra text can also be included in the message bundle with a name based on the message type.

      • message

        public void message(AppContext context,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res,
           java.lang.String message_type)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Show a standard pre-formatted message page from the servlet. This can only be called once as it won't work if any output is committed its the standard way for a servlet to generate output other than redirecting to a submitting page. Pre-formatted messages are defined in bundles and pass through AppContext.expandText(String) before being shown
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        context -
        req -
        res -
        message_type -
        See Also:
        MessageBundleService

      • message

        public void message(AppContext context,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res,
           java.lang.String message_type,
           java.lang.Object... args)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Show a standard pre-formatted message page from the servlet. This can only be called once as it won't work if any output is committed its the standard way for a servlet to generate output other than redirecting to a submitting page. Pre-formatted messages are defined in bundles and pass through AppContext.expandText(String) before being shown
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        context - AppContext
        req -
        res -
        message_type - name of message
        args - array of arguments.
        See Also:
        MessageBundleService

      • confirm

        public java.lang.Boolean confirm(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res,
                        AppContext conn,
                        java.lang.String type,
                        java.lang.Object[] args)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.servlet.ServletException
        process a confirm page It either returns a Boolean object if the answer is available or redirects to the confirm page and returns null. The title and text of the confirm message is defined in confirm.properties
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        Parameters:
        req -
        res -
        conn -
        type - type of message
        args -
        Returns:
        TRUE or FALSE or NULL
